storyInfo: A monster has been attacking passersby near some abandoned shacks. Nymph and Pohl investigate the hauntings and discover that it is a colossus made by Mudrock. Mudrock removes the Arts binding the colossus, and Nymph retrieves the revenant fragment that caused it to go berserk.

attributes.content: My stuff is different from theirs! I picked everything nice and careful. Look at the quality! How could you give me the same price?
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: No difference. Three.
attributes.name: Furnace Node Keeper

attributes.content: How about this, I got another handful of pure Oriron in my pocket. No Originium mixed in at all. I'll add it to the pile for a piece of your bread.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Furnace Node Keeper

attributes.content: Who do you think you are, old man? Three potatoes for three full baskets of Oriron scrap? Did you burn your conscience in the furnace too?
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: My bread is pure white flour. You're not getting it for a handful of slag. Get lost. Next!
attributes.name: Furnace Node Keeper

attributes.content: Two baskets? Put it on the scale. Mm. Two sweet potatoes. Grab it from the ash. Don't try to swipe any; I guarantee you I'll know.
attributes.name: Furnace Node Keeper

attributes.content: I told you to get lost, Bean Sprout. You're in the way.
attributes.name: Furnace Node Keeper

attributes.content: You're not the only furnace keeper in this city, old man. If you won't take this, someone else will.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: You can have this entire batch of bread if you get more than three sweet potatoes from anybody else, you dumb slug.
attributes.name: Furnace Node Keeper

attributes.content: Everybody heard that? No takebacks!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*, they just keep getting worse! The furnace keeper this side's only giving two, and it's cellar leftovers from last year! How am I supposed to make a living?
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: My back's hurting from gathering this stuff all night. It's not even worth a day of food? Anyway, I'm not going back to the old man. Maybe I should check out the market on the east side.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: But the path east would take me past those shacks...
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: The old folks say they dumped broken bodies there during the war, and there's still ghosts who couldn't get back to the myriad souls...
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: No, no, no! Only kids are scared of ghost stories. Of course I'm not scared.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Just a dark alley and a few abandoned shacks.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: He makes up his mind and pushes his rickety cart forward, around scattered piles of firewood and puddles, toward the narrow and winding alley.
A dark borderline cuts open the path ahead. In front is the area in the shadow of the Soul Furnace. The gaunt man slows his steps, and covers the cart with his jacket.
(Gulps) It's just around the corner...
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: How is it so cold at midday? Hah, what's with the weather these days?!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Did something move? Who's there? Who said something?!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: This place has been abandoned for ages... what's that sound? A blade being sharpened? Meat being cut?
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*, I'll just run through with my eyes closed...
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: The cart crashes into a wall, just as he is about to get out of the shadow of the Furnace.
No, not a wall... his eyes run across grey-white metal as he looks up, until they meet a pair of crimson-red counterparts.
Ghost!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Sorry, I think I'm lost. Are you alright?
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: Are you blind? Didn't you see my cart? You, you...?
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Sorry. My fault. See ya.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: No, just... just stay there! Don't move!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: What's up with the weather? How is it so hot when I don't even see the sun? I'm soaked with sweat.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: So many weirdos in town these days...
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: You again? I thought you went west.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: A pair of blood-red eyes rise slowly from the shadows in a corner, rising above the Sarkaz's head, above the shacks by the wayside, above the wilted trees.
The heavy figure turns slowly, emerging from the furnace's shadows. The tattered linen cannot hide the grey-white cracks, but they fill the Sarkaz's vision.
(Hoarse growl)
attributes.name: Linen-Draped Monster

attributes.content: It-It's true... I... *Sarkaz expletive*.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: The young Sarkaz's eyes roll into his head. He lets go of his cart and falls unconscious to the ground.
Let's take a break. There's water over there to wash your face.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Well, I got dirt all over my face, but at least we have something to show for it. If nothing else, we got that huge rock out of the construction site.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Who would thought that only a thin outer layer is iron, and the rest is just ash?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Where do we go next?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: To the east side is the market. You can find all sorts of stuff there, but they close early, and it's practically a ghost town by the time the Furnace's shadow rises above the east wall.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Don't step on my writing practice, Nymph!
attributes.name: Furnaceside Kid

attributes.content: Oh, sorry, Cherie. Does your grandpa have you watching the fire by yourself again?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: He said he was going to work at the construction site. He always comes back stinky and falls right asleep. Doesn't even tell me any stories.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: Hey, Nymph, since you're here, how are these words?
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: You're practicing writing on the ash? But it's...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Fresh furnace ash is very clean!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Great work, Cherie! You got all the words I taught you last time right. I should give you a treat...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I've got a candy here.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Candy! But... I don't want candy. I'm afraid that...
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: Afraid of what?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: That the monster in the alley might take it...
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: Over there, that haunted alley. They say ghosts come for you if you get close to the shacks.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: They follow you and snatch your stuff when you're not looking!
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: You must be joking.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's real! A lot of people have run into them. Some lost their candy, others lost the linens they put out to dry. They say the ghosts don't target you if you don't carry anything good.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: They probably got robbed by some thugs and were too embarrassed to tell the truth.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Don't play with this guy, Nymph! He's bad, he won't believe me.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: Alright, don't cry. You say a lot of people saw the, er, ghost?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Yeah! Ask Bean Sprout if you don't believe me. He just ran into one.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: Yes, it was three stories tall, wrapped in bandages, and bleeding from its eyes.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Wait, didn't you say there were flames coming out from all over? Don't the bandages catch fire?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Yeah, ghostfire. It's cold, so it doesn't burn.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Er, alright, go on.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: What else is there to say? What else could I do?
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: I did a backflip in midair and dodged the ghostfire, then aimed for its eyes with a handful of iron scrap. The monster never saw it coming.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: A backflip? Just yesterday you said your back was hurting and asked me to carry your firewood to your door...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I must be a natural. It felt like energy just kept flowing out from inside me.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: *sigh* We should ask someone else.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Don't! No one else could tell it half as good as me!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: They all fainted when they saw the thing and ran for their lives without looking back when they came to their senses. They even left the carts they borrowed at the scene. What would they know?
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: You're not talking about yourself, are you?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: What if I am...? You got a problem with me? I'm not afraid of you!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: We really don't have time for this. Quit babbling and spit it out.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: PohlConsultant, he just ran into something real scary, don't be too hard on him.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Wha-Consultant? You're the Consultant? Oh, I'm so sorry! I wouldn't have skipped anything if I knew the Consultant was here to interrogate me himself.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: I wouldn't call it an interrogation...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's those haunted shacks on the east side, I'm sure you know them. I ran into it there. It was crouched in a corner at first, so I didn't notice, but then I took a closer look
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: It was draped in linen with blood-red eyes, twice as tall as me, and it was grinding its teeth as it was walking. I was so scared I fainted right there.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: I was still in one piece when I woke up, so I thought I was dreaming at first, but then I reached behind my head and felt the bump where I hit it. See, it's right here
attributes.name: Bean Sprout
Pohl
attributes.content: That's fine, I don't need to see it.

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: You think that's the monster we're looking for, Nymph?
(Shakes head) We'd better go and see if the detector responds. It's not far.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Nymph, Consultant, that's the whole truth, whatever you lost, it really wasn't me. Life's hard enough as it is.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Don't worry, we're not here to give you trouble.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: But you should get your cart back, or else I can't promise you that Big Head won't give you trouble.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The young Sarkaz's smile freezes. He pats his own head in chagrin, only to hit the fresh bump. He grimaces in pain.
Can I ask one more favor, Nymph...?
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Here's the shack he was talking about. It's been abandoned for ages, though.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Is your detector reacting?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: No... are we looking in the right place?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: More likely the kid lied.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Does she know there are Sarkaz ashes in the pile she's writing in?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I'd guess no. You protect her well.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: ...Is that 'protecting'?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Of course it is. Anyway, it would be pretty embarrassing if we got tricked by a kid.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: But we're here, and if it really is the work of some thug
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: We might as well take care of him.
attributes.name: Pohl
Pohl
attributes.content: Come in, there's no...

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: Oh.
Nymph is about to speak when she sees a blade pressing against the back of Pohl's neck.
The blade is blunt and chipped, but the hand is surprisingly steady, pressing against Pohl's neck three centimeters beneath his ear, without the slightest movement.
Nymph, don't.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: The Djall has drawn her staff. The Arts wave emanating from it does not dissipate at Pohl's words and continues to intensify.
He won't kill me.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You wanna bet?
attributes.name: Cold Voice

attributes.content: Put the blade down!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It's alright, trust me. No need for bets here. After all
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Argh
attributes.name: Cold Voice

attributes.content: I can handle one wounded warrior on my own.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Your hand is bleeding... but it's not Sarkaz blood. Who are you?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: This is my home. You don't get to ask who I am.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: No, this is Kazdel, home of the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Pohl
Pohl
attributes.content: Let me see your face...

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: Haven't I seen you before? In the settlement outside the city. You were smuggling out food with... Mudrock was the name, I think.
Mudrock? I think I've heard... mentioned the name before. Are you with Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: If you know our boss, can you help me up? I can barely move my arm.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: This is the third time I've said it. They're not smugglers. They went to work for food at the construction site.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Why didn't I go? I would have, if not for this arm.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: If you're not smugglers, why did you come into the city while hiding in a haunted shack?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Where else can I stay? This is the only place where no one bangs down the door at night.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: You can't sleep at night in the crowded areas, and you can't even go out during the day without someone tearing the door down for firewood.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: There was a Caprinae thief who cut his horns short, stealing steel and bricks from the construction site... is he with you?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Definitely not. Why would I do something so stupid? Cutting my horns to pretend to be Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Not much better living in a haunted house and pretending to be a ghost.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: We never pretended to be ghosts. Don't blame us when stupid people fool themselves.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Your friends weren't at the construction site to steal bricks and steel?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: What a joke. I'm not even Sarkaz and I know that's impossible
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Are you seriously suspecting a Child of Soil and Stone of stealing bricks and tiles?
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Child of Soil and Stone? That Mudrock's a Gargoyle? I never noticed...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It would make sense. Last time I saw Mudrock, she was working on houses outside the city, helping Infected from elsewhere start new farms.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Then again, why do you have to come into the city? Is there something you have to be here for, when you have a Child of Soil and Stone helping you?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Before we talk about the fact that it was Mudrock's decision to come into the city to begin with, what gives you the right to question us?
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: You think we're afraid of the Sarkaz in the city?
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: No... we're afraid of you.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: (Sigh) When is your boss coming back? We can't wait all day.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: She would normally be back by now, but without me, and with the colossi gone, it might take another hour or so.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Let's wait. I need to see their boss. They can't stay here in the city... it's too dangerous.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Ahem. You speak Sarkaz very well, sir. Is that a Leithanian accent? What's your name?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Save it.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Alright, Mr. Save It, would you please move inside a little? I would like to sit down too.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: The sun sets little by little. Nymph looks at the detector in her hand; it is unclear what she is thinking.
Pohl stands up and sits down again, then stands up again, finally ducking down into a crouch, counting the gravel on the ground.
The shadow of the Furnace passes over the east wall. Blood from the wound seeps through the new bandages and coagulates.
The Infected with the injured arm stands up, draws the knife that he left standing on the ground, and peers at the shadow outside.
I'm going to look for them.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: You coming?
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Do you know which construction site they went to?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: No. I'll check all of them if I have to.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: You're just going to march through the streets like that?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: A wounded outsider... how about this, I'll go with you, and if anyone asks...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Shh.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Pohl is still staring at the gravel.
He has separated it into four piles, sorted by color and size, which now tremble and collapse in a unique rhythm.
They're back.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Mudrock... they found it...
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Thump. Thump.
Thump.
The heavy footsteps stop at the entrance to the alley. Nymph and Pohl soon hear the faint sounds of metal scrapingthe sound of blades being drawn.
Mudrock
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: I'm alright!
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: The Child of Soil and Stone walks out from the corner, seemingly oblivious to her friend's call and making no motion in particular, but the Infected who follow her put away their weapons.
Mudrock walks into the battered shack and throws her shovel in a corner.
Come in.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Sit.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Rope.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: The three statements flow from Mudrock's mouth in the same tired tone, with virtually no interruption.
Nymph sits down on the stool opposite Mudrock. The Infected stream into the room, leaving behind two holding a rope that stretches into the alley.
A Djall?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Er, hello, Mudrock! Yes, I'm a Djall. My name's Nymph. My mom and dad are both Djaj. I don't know if you've seen my sister at Rhodes Island...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: They are here?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Well, no. I came to...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: She's trying to chase us out.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Don't interrupt, Stick. Go on.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: We came looking for something. Someone ran into a terrifying monster near this shack, and we suspect it has something to do with what we're looking for.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: My guess is that it's just a misunderstanding. There's no monster at all...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I know what you mean. We're the 'monster'. That's how the Sarkaz here see us.
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: No, that's not what I mean.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The Sarkaz here aren't much different from those in the settlement outside. They're here because they don't have anywhere else to go.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: As far as monsters go, Sarkaz have been treated as monsters by other races for as long as Kazdel has stood.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: You must know what I mean, Mudrock. Please, explain to them...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Mm. Probably not a misunderstanding.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The monster, did it look like that?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Hey, a hand?
attributes.name: Infected at the Door

attributes.content: Who? Me? Er, okay.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (Anxious roar)
Wh-What the heck is that?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Hold it tight! Drag it in!
attributes.name: Infected at the Door

attributes.content: One, two! One, two!
attributes.name: Infected at the Door

attributes.content: With the rope tied around their waists, the Infected wrap it around their shoulders and pull with all their strength.
Pohl looks with astonishment at the thing being pulled out from the shadows.
It is about twice as tall as a man, its eyes blood-red, draped in tattered white linen, with metal wires and ropes tied tightly around it.
The monster.
Tie it up!
attributes.name: Infected at the Door

attributes.content: What? How? Where? You sure about this? That thing could collapse this rickety shack with a single kick.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Just listen to Mudrock. Tie it up.
attributes.name: Infected at the Door

attributes.content: How did you catch it, whatever this... THING is?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: The detector is vibrating! Is that your colossus, Mudrock?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Yeah, I saw it by the road on the way back.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: It was working just fine yesterday, maybe a little slow, but nothing was broken. Then it suddenly ran out in the middle of the night and wouldn't come back.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Couldn't sense it with Arts, either. It's like something was interfering... do you know what's going on?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Maybe it's under the influence of a revenant fragment.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Revenant? What do they have to do with it?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Well... actually, can I see the colossus first?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Be careful. It lashes out at anyone. All my guys here have taken a few hits.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Did it break, uh, Stick's arm?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: No, he broke it in a fight over some work at the construction site.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Come on, Mudrock, you wouldn't stand up for me back there, and now you're doing this in front of some outsiders?
attributes.name: Wounded Infected

attributes.content: Did I not stand up for you? I took all his work. He spent the whole day in the sun without getting a single grain of corn.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Anything else I should know about the colossus?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It seems to be scared of me. It runs away as soon as it sees me. I would have caught it a long time ago, if I wasn't worried that it would topple the furnace if it got into the plaza.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Nothing else, really, Nymph... it's Nymph, right? Be really careful, if it was the revenant that made it go berserk.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: There aren't many Djaj in Kazdel. I don't want to get one hurt, as soon as I met her.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: A-Alright, thanks for the advice.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Nymph takes out her detector and cautiously approaches the colossus.
One step, two steps... as she takes the third step, the detector emits a screeching alarm.
So that's it!
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: No, it's not... it's there.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The Djall points to a crack on the colossus. A piece of rubble seems to have gotten lodged in it.
It is fixed to the colossus like a hateful eye, no matter how the colossus struggles.
I sense something strange.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: It's pain that has lasted centuries... hatred that has lasted a hundred times longer.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: (Hoarse howl)
attributes.name: Rampaging Colossus

attributes.content: This is a revenant fragment, Mudrock. I think that's why it went berserk.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: People were attacked, but not injured. I didn't think about why that was, but now... I think it just doesn't hurt the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: ...I see. The revenant are like Kazdel. They reject anyone who isn't Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: We need to get the fragment out. Can you help me, Mudrock? You created this colossus, you should be able to control it.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Make it stay still. Just a little while will do.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Mudrock raises a hand to the colossus. It seems to feel the threat and struggles even harder.
The metal wires began to break where they have been weakened by rust, stirring up clouds of dust as they hit the ground.
The red glow in the colossus's eyes grows brighter, and all present hear a cold, eerie voice in their heads.
Oppression... revenge!
attributes.name: Rampaging Colossus

attributes.content: Banish! Banish! Banish!
attributes.name: Rampaging Colossus

attributes.content: All you see is hatred... you could not even tell Sarkaz from outsider. You still raise your fists?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: That is not what a revenant should be. Alright then... let it go.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Are you out of your mind?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: ...Got it. Scatter on the count of three. Three, two, one!
attributes.name: Infected at the Door

attributes.content: Banish!
attributes.name: Rampaging Colossus

attributes.content: Kazdel, for Sarkaz, only!
attributes.name: Rampaging Colossus

attributes.content: What are you, then?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: You're not a revenant, or a Gargoyle. You're just a broken Arts Creation... shouldn't you get out of Kazdel too?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Mudrock, look out!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The colossus begins to emit smoke from every crack and fissure. It seems to grow larger, raising a right fist that has almost grown to the size of the shack.
It is about to bring it down on the young Sarkaz.
The Djall's staff starts to glow. She looks into the colossus's eyes and resolutely recites a few words in Sarkaz. The red light in the construct's eyes grows dimmer with each word.
The shadows behind Nymph become increasingly sinister, as though ready to leap from the gravel at any moment.
An instant before the shadow pierces the ground, Mudrock grabs her hand and snaps her fingers.
Snap
The Arts that hold the colossus together are dispelled, and the construct collapses into a pile of gravel and stone. The fist that it tried to bring down turns into a strong gust of wind.
Before the dust settles, the faint, yellow sunlight has wiped away the last vestige of the sinister shadow.
I can find my way from here.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It's okay, I'm going to Rhodes Island's branch office here to report on the revenant anyway. We're going the same way.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Is it safe to put it in that little box?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Totally safe! It's Lichcraft.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: As for you and your friends... I know the guard on duty today. I can have him sneak you out of the city without drawing attention.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Why should we leave?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Just like that colossus, there are a lot of people here who won't tolerate an outsider living next door.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Your people need to eat and sleep, but that's not any easier to come by in the city.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Maybe I didn't bring them here just to eat and sleep.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: In the past, not so long ago, there were more than just Sarkaz in this city.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: People came from far away to teach, heal, build. They weren't here just to eat and sleep.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: You mean Babel... but they left, and you know as well as I do why they left.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It was just a dream, like the kind you get when you're running a fever. I'm glad it was part of my childhood, but it wasn't always a good thing for Kazdel and the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Kazdel is fragile... it can't handle anything like that happening again.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Are you speaking for yourself, or for all Sarkaz? Kazdel is not so fragile, from my point of view, and the Sarkaz have never been that fragile.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: The bad can be avoided. The good will always be good.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: There are things that Kazdel has to face. Kazdel is the last hope for some people, and they can't live in the settlement outside the city forever.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: You're Sarkaz. Your friends aren't.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: They trust me, like I trust Amiya.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Amiya... Rhodes Island. I've heard about your ideals. They're... attractive.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Now I'm even more curious. What is Rhodes Island like?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: You can come with me to see Amiya. It's not far, just past that street.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: She's in Kazdel?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Let me do this first, though. I said I would, and the one I promised... I'd rather not get on their bad side.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Nymph waves the box. The spinning rocks within make no sound.
Mudrock nods and walks toward the Furnace.
(Yawn) You done chatting?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Yeah. Where do we go next?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I would say the market on the east side, but they're long done for the day.
attributes.name: Pohl
Pohl
attributes.content: Why don't we call it quits too?

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: Hm... but I feel like I forgot something. What could it be?
Oh no! Bean Sprout's cart!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Isn't Nymph back yet?
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: I'm gonna get a bump bigger than Big Head's head if he comes back first!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: What are you worried for? Nymph always comes through.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: Look, over thereNymph!
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: My cart! Thank goodness!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Isn't there someone to thank besides goodness?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Thank you! Thank you so much! The ghost didn't catch you, did it?
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Stop scaring Cherie with that ghost and monster talk! Just some thugs up to no good. The Consultant taught them a lesson.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: But the homes there are in disrepair, and the roads are really narrow. You should avoid the place.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Really? But they saw a bunch of people getting chased around by the monster from one end of the city wall to the other!
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: Maybe the ghost is after you, Nymph.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: Maybe you should teach me a few more words today, just in case you can't come tomorrow.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: ...I'll be fine, don't worry.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: She's got a special way of showing concern.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's getting late. I should head back before the Broken Horns start getting ideas without me around.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Meeting that Mudrock gave me an idea. Do you think some of the fireworks might have fallen outside the city?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: How about this, I'll touch base with smugglers outside tomorrow, and take a look around the Military Commission garrison while I'm at it.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Alright, I'll check out the east market. If you find anything, call me immediately. Don't put yourself in danger.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: No problem. See you later!
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Hey, Big Head! What happened to your hand? It's all swollen.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: Oh, er, big guy, here's your cart.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Just leave it over there.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Well, er, if there's nothing else, I'll be going.
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: Get lost, I'm too tired to deal with your crap right now.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Whew, I thought you were going to punch me. Did you not eat at all today, Big Head? Why the sullen look?
attributes.name: Bean Sprout

attributes.content: What did you just call me?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Why is the front of the cart dented? And the handle cracked?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Come here! Let me hear you loud and clear.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Please, no, help, mercy!
attributes.name: Bean Sprout
